entry.title: We submitted a paper to CVPR 2025

link.title: We submitted a paper to CVPR 2025

entry.content:
I am delighted to announce the submission of our research paper, â€œSymbolic Representation for Any-to-Any Generative Tasks,â€ to the 2025 Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (CVPR). This work represents a collaborative effort with my colleagues to advance the field of computer vision and generative AI.

The paper is currently under review. CVPR, as one of the premier conferences in computer vision and machine learning, provides an excellent platform for disseminating our work to the broader research community.

Note: The conferenceâ€™s peer review process is ongoing, and acceptance notifications are pending.
entry.summary: I am delighted to announce the submission of our research paper, â€œSymbolic Representation for Any-to-Any Generative Tasks,â€ to the 2025 Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (CVPR). This work represents a collaborative effort with my colleagues to advance the field of computer vision and generative AI.

entry.title: NeurIPS Workshop accepted our paper for poster presentation

link.title: NeurIPS Workshop accepted our paper for poster presentation

entry.content:
We are pleased to announce our paper â€œGenerative Models in Protein Engineering: A Comprehensive Surveyâ€ has been accepted for poster presentation at the NeurIPS 2024 Foundation Models for Science Workshop.

Join us on December 14, 2024, in Vancouver, Canada, where we will present our comprehensive review of generative modeling approaches in protein engineering.
entry.summary: We are pleased to announce our paper â€œGenerative Models in Protein Engineering: A Comprehensive Surveyâ€ has been accepted for poster presentation at the NeurIPS 2024 Foundation Models for Science Workshop.

entry.title: Astrophysical Journal published our paper
entry.content:
We are pleased to announce our paper â€œVariable Stars in M31 Stellar Clusters from the Panchromatic Hubble Andromeda Treasuryâ€ has been published by the American Astronomical Society on October 17, 2024.

I am delighted to share a milestone in my research journey. A project I joined in June 2020, during my junior year of high school, has culminated in a publication in a premier astrophysical journal. This four-year journey has taught me firsthand that meaningful research requires persistence and patience. I am deeply grateful to my mentors, Dr. Monika D. Soraisam and Prof. Puragra Guhathakurta, for their invaluable guidance and support throughout this journey.
entry.summary: We are pleased to announce our paper â€œVariable Stars in M31 Stellar Clusters from the Panchromatic Hubble Andromeda Treasuryâ€ has been published by the American Astronomical Society on October 17, 2024.

entry.title: I am accepted into USC W.V.T. Rusch Undergraduate Engineering Honors Program

link.title: I am accepted into USC W.V.T. Rusch Undergraduate Engineering Honors Program

entry.summary: I am really happy about it.

entry.title: Just found this USC W.V.T. Rusch Undergraduate Engineering Honors Program! ğŸ“

You know what? I think Iâ€™m gonna go for it! Even if I donâ€™t end up completing the whole program (no pressure, right?), the extra courses look super interesting and could really come in handy for my future research dreams. I mean, why not level up my engineering game while I can? ğŸš€

entry.title: Next Stop: USC! (And Why I Chose It)

link.title: Next Stop: USC! (And Why I Chose It)

entry.content: Iâ€™ve decided to continue my college studies at USC. After considering my options between University of Michigan, UC San Diego, and National University of Singapore, I chose USC primarily for its favorable professor-to-student ratio. This was a key factor in my decision since Iâ€™m keen to get involved in research. With just over two years until grad school application deadlines, Iâ€™m planning to join a lab soon and begin building my research experience. Looking forward to making the most of this opportunity.

entry.title: I Got into Northeasternâ€™s Honors Program (with an $88K Scholarship!)

link.title: I Got into Northeasternâ€™s Honors Program (with an $88K Scholarship!)

entry.content: I am honored to be selected by the Northeastern University Admissions Committee for the prestigious Northeastern University Honors Scholarship. This merit-based award recognizes incoming students admitted to the Northeastern University Honors Program. The scholarship provides $22,000 for the first year, followed by $11,000 per semester in subsequent years, for a total award of up to $88,000 over the course of study.
entry.summary: I am honored to be selected by the Northeastern University Admissions Committee for the prestigious Northeastern University Honors Scholarship. This merit-based award recognizes incoming students admitted to the Northeastern University Honors Program. The scholarship provides $22,000 for the first year, followed by $11,000 per semester in subsequent years, for a total award of up to $88,000 over the course of study.
